author: Valerie Bauerlein
title: Two Decades After Jonesboro Shooting, Survivors Still Haunted
text:
As thousands march in Washington to end gun violence, a small group will meet on a school playground in Jonesboro, Ark., to mark the 20th anniversary of one of the first mass school shootings in modern U.S. history.
On March 24, 1998, four students and a teacher were killed at Westside Middle School by two students who pulled a fire alarm and then shot at their classmates as they streamed out of the building.
